environment-management/adding-an-environ.title: How to add an Environment
environment-management/adding-an-environ.description: Adding an environment in Aquaware is simple and can be done either via the Aquaware app or through our API.

environment-management/delete-environmen.title: Delete an Environment
environment-management/delete-environmen.description: To delete an environment, you can use the following API endpoint:

environment-management/get-all-environme.title: Get All of My Environments
environment-management/get-all-environme.description: To retrieve a list of all the environments associated with your account, you can use the following API endpoint:

environment-management/get-public-enviro.title: Get All Public Environments
environment-management/get-public-enviro.description: To retrieve a list of all publicly available environments, you can use the following API endpoint:

environment-management/update-environmen.title: Update My Environment
environment-management/update-environmen.description: To update an environment that you have previously created, you can use the following API endpoint:

measurement-management/get_alert_setting.title: Get Alert Settings
measurement-management/get_alert_setting.description: Alerts are only available in the Advanced or Business plan. You can retrieve the current alert threshold settings for any water parameter within your environment. Alerts will notify you via email when thresholds are crossed, sent to your registered email address.

measurement-management/get_all_values_fr.title: Get All Values From Parameter
measurement-management/get_all_values_fr.description: The Get All Values From Parameter endpoint allows you to retrieve all water values for a specific parameter in an environment. This is useful for monitoring trends over time, for example, checking how the pH level or temperature of the water has changed.

measurement-management/get_latest_from_a.title: Get Latest Values from All Parameters

measurement-management/get_total_entries.title: Get Total Entries for a Parameter

measurement-management/save_alert_settin.title: Save Alert Settings
measurement-management/save_alert_settin.description: Alerts are only available in the Advanced or Business plan. You can set threshold alerts for your water parameters through the API or directly in the app. Once set, alerts will notify you via email when a water parameter exceeds the defined threshold. The emails are sent to the account's registered email address.

user-management/create-an-account.title: Create an Account
user-management/create-an-account.description: Creating an account with Aquaware is simple and can be done in just a few steps. You can either sign up directly through our website or, soon, directly through the app.

user-management/jwt-tokens.title: JWT-Tokens
user-management/jwt-tokens.description: When you log into Aquaware, you receive JWT Tokens that are essential for authenticating and authorizing your requests to the API. JWT (JSON Web Token) is a secure, compact token format used to represent information between two parties.

user-management/login.title: Login
user-management/login.description: To access your Aquaware account, you can log in either through our website, the app or programmatically using our API. After logging in, you'll receive JWT tokens, which are crucial for future authorization.

user-management/refresh-access-token.title: Refresh Access Token
user-management/refresh-access-token.description: The Refresh Access Token process is essential to keep your session alive without requiring a new login each time your access token expires. By using the refresh token, a new access token can be generated to ensure continuous authentication.
